section.name: Hippo Site Toolkit Development Roadmap
section.p:
This section describes the general development roadmap of the Hippo Site Toolkit for HippoECM. This roadmap is an outline of the functionality and the components that will be released in future versions of the HST.
The development will focus on a flexible and extendible toolkit with which developers can create websites with content from HippoECM.
The HST should be a joy to work with when you build a site with the repository :-). This roadmap is a general list of components and functionalities that will end up in future releases. Any feedback on these issues is more than welcome

subsection.name: Content to URL Mapping
subsection.p: To display repository content by the view techology (jsp, jsf) a flexible mapping is required. Initially this mapping will be configured in a static resource like an xml file or by Spring. In a later version this might end up in the repository. in a later release

subsection.name: Templating
subsection.p: Templating can be very useful in sites that unlock repository content and to speed up development. For this purpose the HST will have functionality to add templates of proven templating frameworks to the repository and to maintain them ` with the cms. The frameworks will include:

subsection.name: Caching
subsection.p: For a good performance the HST will have support for caching.

subsection.name: JSP Tags
subsection.p: The HST will provide a number of useful tags. These can be divided in core tags, giving the tools to retrieve and write content to the repository and tags that facility more extensive functionality.

ul.li: Tags for retrieving and writing repository content
A tag for retrieving faceted content
A tag that provides context state (the current document, repository connection etc.)
A tag for follow-ups/comments on documents
